website_summaries.verdict: With its good-quality leather upper, the Diadora Capitano LT Indoor provides a comfortable fit even for players with wide feet. It has a classic look that is not only eye-catching on the pitch but for daily walks as well. Another plus for this soccer cleat is its soft touch on the ball. Although there were some reviewers who were skeptical about the durability of this soccer cleat, the Diadora Capitano LT Indoor still offers great value for your money overall.
pros: ‘Comfortable’ is the word that majority of reviewers used to describe the Diadora Capitano LT Indoor
Many users with wide feet felt that this soccer cleat provides an awesome fit
Several people expressed how contented they were with this soccer shoe’s quality
The Diadora Capitano LT Indoor looks good, as mentioned by some players
Aside from playing on the pitch, this soccer cleat is also perfect for everyday walks, according to a couple of commenters
A couple of buyers mentioned that the Diadora Capitano LT Indoor is a great value soccer cleat
One individual felt that this soccer cleat was easy to break into
cons: There were a few users who mentioned that this soccer cleat was a half size big
One commenter complained that the Diadora Capitano LT Indoor felt heavy on foot
A disgruntled buyer was disappointed that the sole had completely worn out after four months of use

customer_reviews.title: A tad on the narrow side
customer_reviews.text: Though I read this in other Amazon reviews prior to ordering, I have a wide foot and these are a tad snug but I think (hope) this high quality soft Italian leather should stretch out a bit. That said, I'm wearing them all day to facilitate the stretching and they are comfortable . They are a beautiful indoor soccer shoe which I wear for everyday walking. My indoor playing days are a distant memory.

customer_reviews.title: Good, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Summer 2016 started searching for my next indoor soccer shoe. Tried many that were in the $40 to $70 range.. I wear a 10.5 to 11. Nikes typically run narrow for me; Adidas versions didn't fit well. Pumas were too tight, even in an 11. Decided to give these Diadoras a try. A 10.5 fit incredibly well. Width is slightly wider than some others with good width in the toe area but without added length. Have now worn these to play in a number of times -- they are proving to be a comfortable shoe.
